items.title: Here's how tariffs will hit the U.S. housing market
items.content: Tariffs could increase builder costs anywhere from $7,500 to $10,000 per home, according to the chief economist of the National Association of Home Builders.
items.contentSnippet: Tariffs could increase builder costs anywhere from $7,500 to $10,000 per home, according to the chief economist of the National Association of Home Builders.

items.title: Trump's tariffs could quickly cut North American auto production by a third
items.content: A third of North American vehicle production could be cut by next week as a result of Trump's 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada, S&P Global Mobility reports.
items.contentSnippet: A third of North American vehicle production could be cut by next week as a result of Trump's 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada, S&P Global Mobility reports.

items.title: Southwest Airlines closing 2 crew bases in cost-cutting push
items.content: Southwest plans to close crew bases in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, and Austin, Texas.
items.contentSnippet: Southwest plans to close crew bases in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, and Austin, Texas.

items.title: CFPB drops lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America and Wells Fargo over Zelle fraud
items.content: Since Acting Director Russell Vought has taken over the CFPB, the agency has dropped at least a half dozen cases brought by his predecessor, Rohit Chopra.
items.contentSnippet: Since Acting Director Russell Vought has taken over the CFPB, the agency has dropped at least a half dozen cases brought by his predecessor, Rohit Chopra.

items.title: Target to expand online marketplace, boost product assortment as it aims for $15 billion in sales growth by 2030
items.content: Target hosted an investor day in New York City and outlined its plans to grow over the next five years after issuing fiscal 2024 fourth quarter earnings.
items.contentSnippet: Target hosted an investor day in New York City and outlined its plans to grow over the next five years after issuing fiscal 2024 fourth quarter earnings.

items.content: The comments came in testimony ahead of a House committee hearing on air traffic modernization.

items.title: Trump's Mexico tariffs could raise produce prices in the next few days, Target CEO says
items.content: President Donald Trump's tariffs on Mexico could raise prices on strawberries, avocados and bananas, Target CEO Brian Cornell said.
items.contentSnippet: President Donald Trump's tariffs on Mexico could raise prices on strawberries, avocados and bananas, Target CEO Brian Cornell said.

items.title: Target warns February sales were soft, adding to concerns about consumer health
items.content: Target’s weak first-quarter guidance added to concerns about consumer health after weak January spending numbers and a slide in consumer confidence.
items.contentSnippet: Target’s weak first-quarter guidance added to concerns about consumer health after weak January spending numbers and a slide in consumer confidence.

items.title: Starbucks poaches Nordstrom CFO as executive shake-up continues
items.content: Nordstrom Chief Financial Officer Cathy Smith will join Starbucks, replacing its current CFO Rachel Ruggeri.
items.contentSnippet: Nordstrom Chief Financial Officer Cathy Smith will join Starbucks, replacing its current CFO Rachel Ruggeri.

items.title: Best Buy shares plunge as CEO warns price increases are 'highly likely' due to Trump tariffs

items.title: UConn star Paige Bueckers touts financial literacy as NIL boosts women's sports

items.title: Why foreign retailers like Primark and Mango are expanding across the U.S.

items.title: Domino's Pizza finally launches stuffed crust to keep customers away from rivals

items.title: Oscars 2025: 'Anora' cleans up, Adrien Brody and Zoe Saldana make history

items.title: First-class seats are getting so fancy they're holding up new airplanes

items.title: How a $5 million fix turned Paramount Pictures' 'Sonic' into a billion-dollar franchise

items.contentSnippet: Paramount Picture's redesign of the titular character in its "Sonic the Hedgehog" film has resulted in a $1.2 billion franchise five years later.

items.title: With $1 billion in salary IOUs, the Dodgers spark new questions about MLB's fairness
items.content: The Los Angeles Dodgers' unprecedented deferral of over $1 billion in active player contracts has sparked controversy among MLB fans concerned about fair play.
items.contentSnippet: The Los Angeles Dodgers' unprecedented deferral of over $1 billion in active player contracts has sparked controversy among MLB fans concerned about fair play.

items.title: Trump administration, Musk’s DOGE plan to fire nearly all CFPB staff and wind down agency, employees say
items.content: Employees testified that CFPB leaders and Elon Musk's DOGE want to wind down the agency to five employees, the minimum required under law.
items.contentSnippet: Employees testified that CFPB leaders and Elon Musk's DOGE want to wind down the agency to five employees, the minimum required under law.

items.title: American Airlines to start testing free inflight Wi-Fi

items.title: Egg prices are threatening a classic holiday tradition: Easter dye kits

items.title: Venu is done. Here's how Fox, Disney and WBD plan to go it alone in sports streaming

items.title: Senators grill Trump’s CFPB director pick: You are 'on the Titanic, good luck’
items.content: Since acting CFPB Director Russell Vought took over, the agency closed its Washington HQ, fired staff and told those who remain to stop nearly all work.

items.title: Trump’s proposed 'gold card' visa comes with a hidden tax break for the wealthy
